intro: Vincetoxicum calcicola, commonly known as the rock spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is characterized by its hairy, succulent stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Vincetoxicum calcicola is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and is typically found in areas with limited soil moisture.
